arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Anderson stunner seals win at Huddersfield
arts.sum: Christoph Klarer had an opportunity shortly before half-time when Alex Cochrane floated a free-kick onto his head inside the Huddersfield six-yard box. Laird’s ball across goal wasn’t precise enough for Jay Stansfield or Lyndon Dykes and the latter could only force Terriers stopper Jacob Chapman into a routine save.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies reveals Keshi Anderson talk and why Birmingham City are better with him
arts.sum: “We spoke about the need for real quality moments and we were given one by Keshi Anderson,” said Davies. “Within the first week of pre-season I spoke to Keshi and said I can see why when the games really mattered that you were in the team,” Davies added.

arts.ttl: 'Game changer' - Birmingham City owners Knighthead strike new deal as Tom Wagner speaks - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: Birmingham City's owners Knighthead Capital Management have confirmed that they've entered into a partnership with NASCAR team Legacy Motor Club - something the stock car specialists describe as 'game changing'. Knighthead have a history of investing and partnering with various teams and companies across various industries, including HERTZ, JOTA Racing and Revology Cars, as well as Blues which they are 18 months into the project of.

arts.ttl: Keshi Anderson effort enough as League One leaders Birmingham edge Huddersfield
arts.sum: The visitors will have been the more disappointed of the two sides to go in still goalless at the break after failing to make the most their chances.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City's rivals braced for another transfer body blow in promotion race
arts.sum: Wycombe Wanderers are facing an uncomfortable final week of the transfer window as former manager Matt Bloomfield pursues a reunion with striker Richard Kone at new club Luton Town. "You want players that want to play for your club, and Richard wants Wycombe to get promoted.

arts.ttl: Buzzword led Chris Davies to Kieran Dowell as Birmingham City make pointed transfer decision
arts.sum: The 27-year-old brings a wealth of experience having played 145 games in the Premier League and Championship combined, but he also possesses the ability to create that Blues have lacked in Willum Willumsson’s absence. On Dowell’s body of work and why Blues have signed him, manager Chris Davies told BirminghamLive: “At Norwich he was almost inverting off the right.

arts.ttl: Tom Wagner makes fresh plea over Birmingham City's £3bn Sports Quarter
arts.sum: Birmingham City chairman Tom Wagner has again called on the UK Government to speed up planning processes that are delaying Knighthead’s ambition to build a Sports Quarter in the heart of the Second City. Knighthead controls around £9 billion worth of capital and Wagner is keen to invest in other areas if the Government makes it easier.

arts.ttl: Stoke City set sights on Birmingham City standout
arts.sum: Birmingham City captain Krystian Bielik is attracting interest from Stoke City, according to reporter Fraser Fletcher. Birmingham City… The post Stoke City set sights on Birmingham City standout appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Kieran Dowell reveals why he left Rangers for Birmingham City and Chris Davies selling point
arts.sum: Attacking midfielder Dowell, 27, has signed for Blues on loan from Rangers until the end of the season. “I was in and out at Rangers and I thought it was time for a fresh start,” Dowell told Blues TV.

arts.ttl: Wrexham chant laughable but Stansfield's best is yet to come for Birmingham City
arts.sum: Dykes’ goal was just the sixth Blues have managed from set pieces in the league – only four teams have scored fewer. Chris Davies has identified attacking set pieces as an area in need of improvement and his players have responded with two goals from corners in three matches.
